page.title: 10LOCAL TRANSPORT
page.content: Public transport in Sunderland is almost entirely provided by PTE (Passenger Transport Executive) run by Tyne & Wear Council.Services to outside the Borough are provided by Northen United and National bus companies.One private company, W.H. Jolly,operates a service between South Hylton and the town centre.Sunderland is linked by rail to Newcastle, Middlesbrough however this east-coast line suffers threat of closure.It's hoped one day that Sunderland may be served by the Metro from Tyneside.The road network in Sunderland is constantly being improved.Main roads radiating from the town centre are dual carriageway where possible.There are two ring-roads at present and a third is planned.All transport in the town requires access to a bridge over the Wear.There are three road bridges.
